DataElement.preferredName: Incomplete Blood Cell Count Recovery Cellular Morphology Complete Remission Confirmed Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether morphologic complete remission with incomplete blood count recovery (CRi) was confirmed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Incomplete Blood Cell Count Recovery Cellular Morphology Complete Remission Confirmed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to incomplete (not whole) blood count (the number of red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets in a sample of blood) recovery (getting back or regaining) and the morphologic (cellular morphology is the form and structure of cells, and its relation to cell function) complete remission (the disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment) confirmed (having been established or verified).

ObjectClass.preferredName: Incomplete Blood Cell Count Recovery Cellular Morphology Complete Remission
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Not whole; lacking some necessary part or detail; unfinished.:A test to check the number of red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets in a sample of blood.  Also called complete blood count (CBC).:A getting back or regaining.:Cellular morphology is the form and structure of cells, and its relation to cell function, or the scientific study thereof.:The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.  This does not always mean the cancer has been cured.

Concepts.definition: Not whole; lacking some necessary part or detail; unfinished.
The determination of the number of red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets in a biospecimen.
Cellular morphology is the form and structure of cells, and its relation to cell function, or the scientific study thereof.
The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

Property.preferredDefinition: Confirmed; having been established or verified.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results or effects (does not include CTC Adverse Events) of therapeutic agents or procedures administered to the patient.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
